thread.title: 'Why is Ricky Whittle American now?' Former Hollyoaks star's new LA accent baffles This Morning viewers
thread.title_full: 'Why is Ricky Whittle American now?' Former Hollyoaks star's new LA accent baffles This Morning viewers

author: Hayley Minn
title: 'Why is Ricky Whittle American now?' Former Hollyoaks star's new LA accent baffles This Morning viewers
text:
'Why is Ricky Whittle American now?' Former Hollyoaks star's new LA accent baffles This Morning viewers The Strictly runner-up is originally from Oldham - but you'd never guess it! Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Rick Whittle's accent appears to have changed after USA gig Share this video Get soaps     
Ricky Whittle shot to fame when he starred in Hollyoaks as Calvin Valentine. 
After being a runner-up on Strictly Come Dancing, he then went to Hollywood, and starred in a few US drama series, including The 100. 
He’s about to star in American Gods with fellow British actor Ian McShane, and the two were on This Morning today. 
But as he spoke to Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby on the ITV daytime show, viewers were shocked at his new “affected accent”. 
It seems Ricky has gone all LA. Read More Ricky Whittle's accent baffled This Morning viewers He shot to fame on Hollyoaks (Photo: Liverpool Echo) 
One viewer said: “How long has ricky whittle been in America? Very dodgy accent going on.” 
Another added: “Has Ricky Whittle always had this strange, transatlantic, Mark Ronson-esque accent?” 
A third asked: “But I thought Ricky Whittle was from Oldham? Or is he American now?” 
Another confused fan - referring to his Hollyoaks character’s wife Carmel McQueen - asked: “Why is Ricky Whittle American now? Carmel would be turning in her grave.” 
And it doesn’t look like Ricky is ever coming back to Manchester! Read More But the Oldham actor has gone all LA And it doesn't look like he's ever coming home 
He told Holly and Phil: “I am loving LA. 
“I’d do whatever it takes to stay in California, maybe not LA because it’s so crazy. 
“I’ve moved down to the water.” 
*This Morning continues on ITV1 weekdays at 10.30am Like us on Facebook
